dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A 575 billion dollar acquisition by Google, and the FTC thinks Uber Eats and Deliveroo are merging into one company?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A five hundred seventy five billion dollar acquisition by Google, and the F T C thinks Uber Eats and Deliveroo are merging into one company?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct following a $575 million funding round into Deliveroo in May, which was led by Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that initial enforcement order on Friday is a huge deal. They claim to have irrefutable proof, but they're not sharing the details publicly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that initial enforcement order on Friday is a huge deal. They claim to have irrefutable proof, but they're not sharing the details publicly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct following a $575 million funding round into Deliveroo in May, which was led by Amazon. It declined to specify what these reasonable grounds are, but theyre likely based on public information about the deal, as well as information it has received privately from Amazon and Deliveroo.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and it's especially unusual because Google became a majority shareholder in Deliveroo back in May, when it was only valued at around 2 million dollars.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and it's especially unusual because Google became a majority shareholder in Deliveroo back in May, when it was only valued at around two million dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The probe from the CMA is somewhat unusual given Amazon is only a minority shareholder in Deliveroo, which was last valued at $2 billion in 2017 when it raised a $482 million round.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, which makes you wonder what evidence they've got that's so compelling. They mentioned private information from Google and Uber Eats themselves.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, which makes you wonder what evidence they've got that's so compelling. They mentioned private information from Google and Uber Eats themselves.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It declined to specify what these reasonable grounds are, but theyre likely based on public information about the deal, as well as information it has received privately from Amazon and Deliveroo.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's the concern about competition—like, could this lead to Uber Eats orders through Amazon Alexa? That feels like a massive consolidation of power.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's the concern about competition-like, could this lead to Uber Eats orders through Amazon Alexa? That feels like a massive consolidation of power.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Closer cooperation between the two companies could see Deliveroo customers placing orders via Amazon Alexa, or a takeover would give the Seattle-based giant a second try at the food delivery business after it scrapped its rival service Amazon Restaurants in June.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And Uber Eats operates in 50 cities globally with 6,000 riders... that's a huge network that could really dominate if it teams up too closely with a giant like Amazon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And Uber Eats operates in fifty cities globally with six thousand riders... that's a huge network that could really dominate if it teams up too closely with a giant like Amazon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Founded in 2013 by former Morgan Stanley investment banker Will Shu and software engineer Greg Orlowski, Deliveroo has scaled its business at a rapid pace; the company now operates in 500 towns and cities in 14 countries around the world. It relies on an army of 60,000 riders to transport food from 80,000 restaurants to people's homes and offices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But an Amazon spokesperson said they're disappointed, which, like, of course they are. Meanwhile, European regulators seem to be cheering on U.S. tech lately.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But an Amazon spokesperson said they're disappointed, which, like, of course they are. Meanwhile, European regulators seem to be cheering on U.S. tech lately.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, European regulators are clamping down on U.S. tech giants over allegedly monopolistic and uncompetitive tactics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the European Commission praised Google for pushing its own shopping service, which is kinda ironic given the FTC's stance here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the European Commission praised Google for pushing its own shopping service, which is kinda ironic given the F T C's stance here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For example, Google was fine recently by the European Commission for promoting its own Google Shopping service in its search results ahead of other retailers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So this initial enforcement order is basically meant to speed things up while they decide on a deeper, 90-day Phase 3 investigation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this initial enforcement order is basically meant to speed things up while they decide on a deeper, ninety-day Phase three investigation?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A spokeswoman for the CMA told Forbes that the initial enforcement order (IEO) has been issued to effectively pause the deal between Amazon and Deliveroo while it decides whether it needs to complete what is known as a Phase 1 investigation, which would last for 40 days.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's the idea. But Jonathan Branton from DWF pointed out that minority stake investigations are common, and ending them early suggests no major competitive threat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the idea. But Jonathan Branton from D W F pointed out that minority stake investigations are common, and ending them early suggests no major competitive threat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Jonathan Branton, head of EU competition at DWF, said: Investigations into acquisitions of minority stakes are certainly less common than they are for standard acquisitions, but that is not to say they do not happen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, Erin Platts from Barclays warned that blocking Google's funding could seriously hurt Uber Eats' ability to raise money elsewhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, Erin Platts from Barclays warned that blocking Google's funding could seriously hurt Uber Eats' ability to raise money elsewhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Erin Platts, head of Silicon Valley Bank in EMEA, told Forbes that Deliveroo wouldnt have too much difficulty finding other investors if the CMA prevented it from accepting money from Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which just shows how tangled and high-stakes these tech investments have become. Everyone's watching to see how this plays out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which just shows how tangled and high-stakes these tech investments have become. Everyone's watching to see how this plays out.

artist_script:
HostA: A 575 billion dollar acquisition by Google, and the FTC thinks Uber Eats and Deliveroo are merging into one company?
HostB: Yeah, that initial enforcement order on Friday is a huge deal. They claim to have irrefutable proof, but they're not sharing the details publicly.
HostA: Right, and it's especially unusual because Google became a majority shareholder in Deliveroo back in May, when it was only valued at around 2 million dollars.
HostB: Exactly, which makes you wonder what evidence they've got that’s so compelling. They mentioned private information from Google and Uber Eats themselves.
HostA: And then there's the concern about competition—like, could this lead to Uber Eats orders through Amazon Alexa? That feels like a massive consolidation of power.
HostB: For sure. And Uber Eats operates in 50 cities globally with 6,000 riders... that's a huge network that could really dominate if it teams up too closely with a giant like Amazon.
HostA: But an Amazon spokesperson said they're disappointed, which, like, of course they are. Meanwhile, European regulators seem to be cheering on U.S. tech lately.
HostB: Yeah, the European Commission praised Google for pushing its own shopping service, which is kinda ironic given the FTC's stance here.
HostA: So this initial enforcement order is basically meant to speed things up while they decide on a deeper, 90-day Phase 3 investigation?
HostB: That's the idea. But Jonathan Branton from DWF pointed out that minority stake investigations are common, and ending them early suggests no major competitive threat.
HostA: Still, Erin Platts from Barclays warned that blocking Google's funding could seriously hurt Uber Eats' ability to raise money elsewhere.
HostB: Which just shows how tangled and high-stakes these tech investments have become. Everyone's watching to see how this plays out.
